alert.note: Alert for Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 5:53PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Custer County through 630 PM CDT... At 553 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clinton, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clinton and Arapaho. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 62 and 71. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
